content: At the same time, CP on our side of the railroad, we're doing things in that corridor, north of Kansas City that is sort of getting a step ahead so that as soon as we get these 2 railroads together, the STB gives us a green light, we'll continue to invest in the infrastructure, but the investments we've already made, the traffic that rides it today, the operating plan that we have ready to engage and execute, you're going to see cost synergies that, again, this is not driven by cost synergies, but just railroading better, being more efficient with assets, turning cars faster, putting these 2 networks together and benefiting on the backbone of those capital investments.
